Champlain Leaves Behind a Trail of Lakes

07 Sep 2012

While exploring the Ottawa River, French explorer Samuel de Champlain canoed across a series of lakes that came to be known as the Champlain Trail Lakes. He was a pretty swell guy, attempting to make better relations with local native tribes, as well as establishing the French settlement which we now know as Quebec City. He was also the first European to fully explore and describe the Great Lakes by creating maps and accounts of what he had learned.

It is this art (navigation) that drew me to love the sea at a very young age and that compelled me to challenge its treacherous waters all of my life and that made me navigate and follow the coast of parts of America . . . – Samuel de Champlain

About us

Hypenotic is a marketing strategy, design & development firm that chooses to use its powers for good. We’re a certified founding member of B Corp in Canada, and if you don’t know what that is, it’s time you do. Since ’98, we’ve helped a lot of interesting people do important things. We create relevant communications and useful experiences. Find out more.
